pros: Great, benefits, work life balance, and free tuition for family and yourself. Excellent holiday scheme.
cons: Location, career advancement, organization stagnation, co workers are lifers and it does have it's appeal, but I left to explore the world and looking back, it was great way to start a career as you learned how a large government organization runs.

job_title: Fiscal Technician II in Valdez, AK
pros: Flexible schedule is a pro
cons: Low pay is a con

pros: Got to pick your own hours
cons: Low compensation, no opportunity for advancement

pros: Better than average amount of sick/vacation time.
cons: Pay doesn't compare to similar positions in other industries.

pros: Alaska - weather and people
cons: Alaska - weather, budget and politics

pros: Dedicated faculty and students, community campuses are great places to work.
cons: Constant financial difficulties and variable higher-up leadership.

job_title: Aircraft Maintenance Technician in Anchorage, AK
pros: Benefits, work schedule, work environment.
cons: Work environment, leadership, management, administration.

review_title: Good People but Behind the Curve
job_title: IAM Student Assistant in Fairbanks, AK
pros:
- Helpful, supportive coworkers
- Good benefits
- Commitment to moving forward with new technologies
cons:
- IT resources are spread thin due to recent cuts, frequently leads to overloaded employees
- When I began the job, practices and technologies were badly out of date on my project (no version control, no build system, no tests, Java 1.5). Other departments and projects were much better, though.

pros: The environment is so friendly and everyone supports you in succeeding. You can work your way up in administration easily.
cons: None. Best co-workers and managers I ever knew.

review_title: OK place to work if you are willing to play games...
job_title: Project Manager FS in Fairbanks, AK
pros: Working in a University environment with students. Fairly good benefits except if you are a recent hire. In which case your only retirement option is a 401K. The defined benefit was recently eliminated by the Legislature. The University closes between Christmas and New Years so that is a plus for time off with family, travel, etc...
cons:
A large bureaucracy. It is a very political place to work. In some fields there is not much room to grow as this is a small university. Dead wood has accumulated in several departments resulting in a slow down of project implementation. 
Everything is over studied to the point of stagnation.

review_title: An really interesting place to work, just watch your back.
pros: There are lots of intriguing projects.  The possibility existes to be creative when solving problems.  There is a good balance here between work and family.  The Institute is always involved with cutting-edge research, so people who work here can often feel like inventors.
cons: University funding is limited, and sometims the staff is considered somewhat expendable.  There is little effort to keep payscales in line with market rates, so it is always up to the employee to push for compensation.

review_title: Great organization but slow career path
pros:
Great benefits
Job security
Friendly atmosphere
Low Stress
Small enough that what you do matters and you can see it.
Lots of employees have been there for years so there is a lot of tribal knowledge to go around.
cons:
University bureaucracy
"Tenured" employees
Old technology and processes
Lack of training opportunities (especially in newer technologies)
Can be hard for new people to be accepted (especially if they are from out of state) as there is an unspoken tendency to shun/avoid out-of-staters, but this is uniquely associated to being an Alaskan.
Slow career path, in most cases the position above you has to be vacated for you to advance, that or transfer departments, or hope for a new one to be created(not likely).

job_title: IOS Software Developer in Fairbanks, AK
pros: Coworkers were very friendly, and the atmosphere of the office was very productive. Being a small group, everyone knew everyone, and got along well. Even as a student worker, I was responsible for my own work, and there was no micromanagement.
cons: My biggest complaint would just be a lack of mentor-ship. Being put onto a project largely meant that for most of my time there, being the only one involved in iOS development, there was nobody to engage with on the code, and if the results were of acceptable quality.

pros: Great colleagues, and great students.
cons: Decisions are being made to cut costs that are damaging to the university's future. One college has decided--at a time of falling enrollment--to raise the minimum enrollment for its courses to run. Now many courses have been canceled, and students have less choice. The result will be even fewer students in the future. I've already heard from some who have taken on-line courses from other institutions for exactly this reason. It will be hugely expensive and take many years for the university to recover from a state budget situation made worse by short-sighted decisions made by management.

pros: If you are in the right department, you can work on interesting projects with pleasant people and not much bureaucracy.  The town has beautiful summers and nice people.
cons: If you are in the wrong department (so I hear), office politics and bureaucracy can be bad.  Make sure you have some indoor hobbies to occupy yourself with during the 8 month winter.

pros: Good place for student workers. They do bulk of the work for Biology people. Its nice environment to work for.
cons: Nothing that bad. I wish they had more funding to support more projects and more students. The funding runs out anytime.

pros: Beautiful state, great for people who love outdoor activities,  friendly people, opportunities to develop skills, good benefits/leave, low housing costs
cons: State is  currently financially insecure, not always competitive salary, if you can't handle long cold dark winters, this is probably not the best place for you.

review_title: Good Place, Good Pay (depending on department)
pros:
great place to work depending on department
nice people
relaxed environment
great advancement
cons:
good old boys club at the very top of the structure
little flexibility in changing things

review_title: It's great if you don't need health care
pros: Tuition waiver for free tuition for spouse and family, lots of activities on campus
cons: Health benefits cost more and we receive less each year. Tuition waiver is slowly being phased out.

pros: Living in Alaska is a special experience.
cons: Traveling out of Alaska for professional development can be very inconvenient and expensive. Opportunities of research collaboration are limited. The long, cold winter can be a turn-off for many people.

review_title: Great state to live and great people craving direction.
job_title: Desktop Support Manager in Fairbanks, AK
pros: Love the state, great place to be to get away from the rat race.
cons: All of the great employees here are demoralized because of the lack of direction.

review_title: The organization is good, management is not great
pros: Decent benefits, nice co-workers, supportive of continuing education
cons: Pay is not great, management is not great

job_title: Senior UNIX Systems Administrator in Fairbanks, AK
pros: Great employer, benefits, and a competitive salary.
cons: Several of the departments within the greater technology department are siloed.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Anchorage, AK
pros: Great project and very helpful in completing the tasks at hand.
cons: The state of the university, financially, is not very suitable for new assistants.

pros: I can not recommend this employer, not even to folks I do not care for.
cons: After many stressful years with this employer, I acquired workplace PTSD, and unemployment late in my career life!!!

pros: Great place to work, great benefits
cons: None at this time, salary raises

job_title: Me At Arsc in Fairbanks, AK
pros: A great place to work
cons: can't get more people to work at arsc

pros: HR accessible and friendly. Work conditions reasonable.
cons: No complaints to register. Enjoyed my time at UAA
